title: What even is the appeal of this game anymore?
body:
Ranked is a clusterfk of toxic kids and luck.

Normals a clusterfk of toxic kids.

Riot have zero care towards expanding gameplay, there are no more the 20 viable champs at any one time, there are no new game modes, and there aren't even any community events, they hoard the money off morons and children alike.

And all eSports is is a new age way to advertise their game and profit massively off twitch views at the same time, and invest NONE of it back into their game or esports, *spend thousands of hours of your life in our ranked system and maybe you can be pro
*The majority of pros have been the same since season 1 and 2, they are glorified Riot employees.

I want this game to die so it stops monopolizing a large portion of the gaming market, and a game with some content and fun gameplay with interesting game modes can actually get the support it needs to flourish, not just some crappy game with like 120 2d champs and one 2d map farming money off kids all over the world making some chinese billionaire richer everyday

replies.body:
> there are no more the 20 viable champs at any one time

Wrong.

> there are no new game modes

Hexakill TT; Shurima; Death Bots; All for one

> and there aren't even any community events

Ocean Week; Team Up Week

> profit massively off twitch views at the same time

Do you mean subscribers on Twitch? Those are voluntary, and Twitch doesn't pay per view.

> spend thousands of hours of your life in our ranked system and maybe you can be pro

Is this different to any other game, sport, or career? 

> I want this game to die so it stops monopolizing a large portion of the gaming market

DOTA 2 set two world records for biggest prize pool. They also rivalled League's active player base in 2014 (bear in mind it's much harder to set up smurf accounts through Steam). The MOBA market is a duopoly at worst, and I don't understand how Riot own the entire gaming market when they only operate on 1/4 major gaming platforms.

> a game with some content and fun gameplay with interesting game modes can actually get the support it needs to flourish

How are Riot actively preventing indie devs from getting support? They also give their employees $300 p/a to spend on other games.

> crappy game with like 120 2d champs and one 2d map

Are you sure you're playing the right game? 

> making some chinese billionaire richer everyday

Riot actually started as an indie dev and are based in the US. They were initially funded by several US venture capital firms, and are now owned by parent company Tencent - the biggest shareholders of which are US-based institutions. 


I was really bored this morning.

Amidst the salt and rage, he's semi-right about the "20 champs viable/time". 

There's not really anything Riot can do about top tier champions thy dominate LCS and Ranked Matches. If there weren't the cream on top of the milk the game would be really boring. 
A couple of seasons ago it was Kassadin mid, Talon mid, and Leblanc mid. 
Hecarim and Nocturne dominated the jungle. 
Renekton was the sole king of top lane. 
Ezreal, Vayne, Caitlyn would be seen every game. Especially Ezreal though. 

Last season it was more dynamic. No one champion dominated the jungle for the the whole season, maybe Lee sin did but ehh.
